revised_title: Comparison of Sound Velocity Experiments in Arctic Regions
tldr: The author compares the results of sound velocity experiments conducted by Captain Parry and Lieutenant Foster in the Arctic regions with the theoretical formula of Laplace. The author concludes that the data used in the calculations are more uncertain in extreme cold, but the general agreement of the results supports the validity of the observations. Captain Parry's experiments provide strong evidence of his exemplary accuracy despite the challenges faced during Arctic exploration.
